Package graph

Interface IGraph

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractGraph, Graph, WeightedGraph
public interface IGraph
The IGraph interface represents a graph. It defines methods for accessing nodes, adding edges, and creating random graphs.

  • Method Summary

    Description

    addEdgeToList(int n1, int n2)
    Adds an edge between the specified nodes.

      Adds an edge between the specified nodes.
      Parameters:
      n1 - The ID of the first node.
      n2 - The ID of the second node.

    • addEdgeToList

      void addEdgeToList(int n1, int n2, int weight)
      Adds a weighted edge between the specified nodes.
      Parameters:
      n1 - The ID of the first node.
      n2 - The ID of the second node.
      weight - The weight of the edge.

      Creates a random graph with a maximum weight for the edges.

      Creates a graph based on the given input parameters.
      Parameters:

    • generateRandomHamiltonianPath

      ArrayList<Integer> generateRandomHamiltonianPath()
      Generates a random Hamiltonian path in the graph.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing the node IDs in the Hamiltonian path.
